intro: Moehringia ponae, commonly known as the alpine mouse-ear, is a small flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Andes. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae, which includes many flowering plants with showy blooms. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to cold, arid environments. Its leaves are usually woolly and succulent, helping to retain moisture in harsh conditions. Moehringia ponae produces small, pink or white flowers that bloom in late spring or early summer.
